newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks end up on Corimon return.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks end up on Corimon return.

text.p: Caracas stocks edged ahead in a mixed session brightened by the return of eight-months absent paints and packaging group Corimon, traders said.
"There was a lot of interest in Corimon, a lot of demand. Over the long term the company, if well-run, could give back a good return," said Profimerca broker Miguel Gonzalez.
The bolsa's index nudged ahead 0.7 percent to close at 6,015.02 as 25 issues rose, 12 fell and two ended flat.
Corimon closed up 8.50 bolivars at 18.00 bolivars in a volatile day of trade -- the first since Venezuela's National Securities Commission (CNV) suspended trade in February.

"Most of that rise was the stock catching-up with the bolsa's gains this year," said Banesco broker Simon Brad. The Caracas bolsa has moved ahead nearly 100 percent in dollar terms since the beginning of the year.
Over 18 million shares traded worth 1.8 billion bolivars ($3.8 million).
Among the day's other major trades, market bellwether Electricidad de Caracas gained 9.00 bolivars to close at 540.00 bolivars.
Traders foresaw much the same pattern for the remainder of the week: a generally flat market punctuated by occasional rises in particular stocks.
